content.question: A spaceship is moving in a straight line with velocity <math alttext="vector v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>â†’</mo></mover></math>. The spaceship has an acceleration that is directed opposite to the direction of the velocity. Which of the following statements about the change in the kinetic energy of the spaceship is correct?

choices.label: The kinetic energy must be decreasing.
The kinetic energy must be increasing.
The kinetic energy may be increasing or decreasing depending on the magnitude of the acceleration.
The kinetic energy is not changing.

content.answer: The kinetic energy must be decreasing.
